articles.title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
articles.description:
Massachusetts drivers now have a chance to snag a piece of the state’s upcoming 250th anniversary celebrations.

The post Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts RMV opens lottery for special 250th anniversary license plates.
Only 250 plates available for residents to commemorate the state's anniversary.
Application period allows Boston drivers to participate in state celebration.

articles.title: Police in Nancy Guthrie investigation say glove DNA didn’t match anything in national database
articles.description:
“There were no DNA hits in CODIS," the Pima County Sheriff’s Department said, referring to the national Combined DNA Index System.

The post Police in Nancy Guthrie investigation say glove DNA didn’t match anything in national database appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Pima County Sheriff’s Department reports no DNA matches in national database for Nancy Guthrie case.
DNA from glove found at the scene yielded no hits in CODIS, complicating the investigation.
Boston residents remain concerned as the case remains unsolved, affecting community safety perceptions.

articles.title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
articles.description:
Some state workers are already wary of the ChatGPT assistant — and of the state’s embrace of the technology at large.

The post Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts is the first state to implement ChatGPT in its executive branch.
Some state workers express concerns about the technology's impact on their jobs.
Governor Maura Healey's decision may influence future AI adoption in local government.

articles.title: Police arrest man who ran toward the US Capitol building holding a shotgun
articles.description:
Capital Police Chief Michael Sullivan said the unidentified man parked a Mercedes SUV near the Capitol, got out and ran “several hundred yards” toward the building when officers intercepted him and ordered him to the ground.

The post Police arrest man who ran toward the US Capitol building holding a shotgun appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Police arrested a man with a shotgun near the US Capitol on February 17.
The suspect ran several hundred yards from a parked Mercedes SUV before being intercepted.
This incident raises security concerns for Boston residents regarding national safety measures.

articles.title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
articles.description:
The Gardner locations of Garlock Flexibles will close by the end of September.

The post Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Garlock Flexibles will close its Gardner locations by the end of September.
Nearly 100 jobs will be lost due to the plant shutdowns.
Local economy in Gardner will face challenges with significant job losses.
